page.title: 10HILL FARMING (SHEEP)
page.content: The main occupation is sheep farming and the most popular sheep is not, as might be supposed, the Wensleydale, but the Swaledale and various local crosses with the Dalesbred and Blue-faced Leicester coming close behind. Lambing is late, taking place mainly in April. The lamb sales are held in September and the main market is the Hawes Auction Mart, four miles to the west. Shearing takes place in July and the majority of the wool is transported to the mills of South Yorkshire, particularly Bradford. The hardest times of year for the sheep farmers are lambing when the weather is seldom Spring-like and mid-winter when fodder must be carried out into the fields or onto the fells.
